original: According to the Marquis of Lozoya, three significant works of art emerged during the 16th century in the colony. These include a mural painting depicting a martyred saint, located in the Treasury Room of the Catedral Primada; a notable copy of the Virgen de la Antigua, found in a chapel of the same cathedral; and La Virgen de Cristóbal Colón, which is believed to be the oldest preserved portrait of Christopher Columbus.
